title: Having some major connection issues
body: Why is it that I am randomly getting massive ping spikes in games. I could have an entire day with normal 72 ping only for it to randomly spike later as the day progresses. I know that the problem is nothing to do with the internet here as I am able to connect well to many other applications, webpages and games just fine. I don't think I would be able to watch a video on Youtube if I really had bad internet. And I'm not just talking bad, I'm talking horrible. Ping at 1000+ causing me to disconnect as I gank. I can only come to one conclusion in my mind, and that is that it has to be the server that is having issues causing random players, in random games, at random times, to have very bad connection. I just need to know if others are having similar issues and if there is a solution. Can someone please enlighten me.

replies.body: Was playing with friends, 3 of us received a huge lag spike at the same time during a team fight which lost us the game :/
I'm getting exactly the same thing.  Vodafone ISP - ADSL2+ plan.  I just spent 5 minutes d/c'd at the end of a match and lost 1/3 of my promo games.  Rest of the internet works fine though.

Same thing happening with me, although i'm with telstra :/.. ADSL 2+.
its making League unplayable for me atleast, one second everything is fine, the next i'm watching minions freeze in place while my team mates health bars are slowly dropping...
but i've also been having my keys unbind themselves as well, last match playing as sion somehow my q and r had unbound themselves :/
In my last game I had 6 huge lag spikes (bout 30 seconds a piece).  And died in 4 of those. C'mon riot.  It's not my firewall.
mine sounds very similar to that. I was once doing raptors with lee and it was like I had a 6 second silence and snare, then when the spike had finished I did everything at once.
